html:
11.25.24  7:31 am   hi do you have a new catch phrase

      books are for looks. change my mind

11.25.24  7:30 am   clicking the RANDOM QUESTION button over and over is more entertaining than social media

      that's great news

11.25.24  6:53 am   Why do you answer only bad questions, rather than suberb ones?

      i have never answered a bad question. this is thanks to a loophole that i believe, which is that bad questions are not bad

11.25.24  4:35 am   What's your favourite question in 2024?

      this one

11.25.24  3:56 am   I keep hearing advice along the lines of "good writers are good because they have something to say; they don't just write for the sake of writing" but I fear I will never have enough to say that I will become a good writer about it. advice ?

      that sounds backwards, actually. Sometimes people who aren't writers have something so important to say that they write it anyway, despite not normally being a writer. Writers, on the other hand, love writing so much that they're just going to keep writing no matter what. but regardless, there's infinite things to say anyway, so you're gonna end up saying things no matter what. if you try to avoid writing because you think there's nothing to say, then you'll never even get a chance to improve, and then you'll have to try to tell other writers not to write either, to prevent them from getting ahead of you

11.25.24  3:35 am   Why does the university keep giving me things to do. Actually you know what I was asking this in the way of "I don't like being so busy all the time they should give me a break" but now that I've phrased the question in the way that I have it feels like they're giving me things to do to be nice to me because things do tend to go wrong for people when they have absolutely nothing to do. So maybe its not so bad after all

      ok let me know if anything else develops

11.25.24  2:36 am   Ok, so I was thinking about chairs, like that chair over there. Not a specific chair, just any chair, and then I wondered "I wonder what would happen if chairs were sentient and were able to voice their opinions?"

And then that's when I started asking "I wonder how they'd react to being used by someone?" would they react like "Oh wow, thank you my use is being fulfilled!" or would it be more like "Hello, can you please stop sitting on me? that is very rude."

But then each chair has their own different opinion, so each chair would feel very different from each other about the whole "people create chairs to sit in chairs" thing.

Maybe some chairs are just too shy to talk about it and prefer to stay quiet so they don't offend anyone. Maybe the other chairs caught on to this and have decided to take a vow of silence so they don't overwhelm each other with their opinions.

Am I onto something with this? Or am I thinking too deeply about chairs?

      unfortunately neither

11.25.24  1:34 am   sometimes i want to do something and i start doing it, but after a while of working on it i just kind of move on to another thing. this has left me with a bunch of different incomplete things, and though it's thankfully been purely hobby things so far like making levels in videogames, i kind of worry that it might be an issue later in life

i think the issue is that i work on one thing too long, and then i end up burning myself out. but i find that weird considering i hardly ever work on any one thing too long. i don't feel like im exerting that much work onto that one thing to actually burn myself out, if that makes sense. and that's probably not a healthy way to think about it now that im actually writing it down

i dunno what do you think

      i think you're doing fine

11.25.24  12:57 am   favorite hex code. I demand it.

      000000

11.25.24  12:28 am   Favorite math problem?

      what is the diagonal length of a square compared to the straight side

11.24.24  9:58 pm   do you still feel strongly about the word 'reasonable'?

      i've never felt strongly about it

11.24.24  9:09 pm   when they have buy one get one off deals at the store do they just give you two and you pay for one, does the second one just magically appear in your cart or do you pay 50% for both of them

      they both need to be scanned. sometimes they might be just in the system as half price, which is less complicated for the system, but the customer may figure out that they can actually just buy 1 at half off if they want. Or, to make it so the customer can't do that, they can set it up the more complicated way which is normal price but it recognizes when you've scanned 2 and it gives you a deduction of the price of 1. of course this can go haywire if you scan too fast or start doing voids or whatever

      2024

      depends on the context

      yes

      maybe you are addicted to the color scheme

11.24.24  6:53 am   bill explain the big picture of reality to me right now

      it's self explanatory. but that doesn't mean anyone has or hasn't figured it out

11.24.24  6:36 am   why do you make music in that genre you make music in and not in any other genre

      what i do is what happens when you don't do it in a genre. of course that won't stop people from trying to call it a genre, but that's not my fault. when it left my office, it was genre-free

11.24.24  4:51 am   Is there anything more important than creating what one must create?

      when you put it that way, maybe not

11.24.24  4:39 am   i've been stuck on a project for a month or two not knowing how to continue. i started it fine but now it feels impossible to imagine whatever i'm trying to create, and it feels like i lost all my creativity. any tips on how i can get it back?

      maybe there are some shrubs in the backyard you could consult with

11.23.24  11:36 am   How can I be less fake?

      the first thing you can do is just rephrase that in the positive, by saying 'how can i be more real'. The way you phrased it, it reminds me of when you learn to drive a car sitting backwards in the back seat, looking out the back window saying 'how do i drive away from there'. that's simply not how the thing operates

11.23.24  11:10 am   Have you ever drawn yourself in a video? In other words, are any of the characters in your videos (the stick figures/simplified human figures in your pre-2020 videos and the more detailed human figures in your post-2020 videos) supposed to represent you in any way?

      i'm creating and controlling all their actions and every word they say, so if none of them resembled me in any way, that would be shocking

11.23.24  10:46 am   i feel oversaturated with information. how do i start feeling more relaxed with everything?

      a bit of time will help you

11.23.24  10:04 am   do you find you often do things because you should do them? or because you want to do them? 

      always look for that sweet spot, where it's both
